Class InputReader

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.View.TUI.InputReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class InputReader extends Object implements Runnable
The InputReader class is responsible for managing user input from the terminal and relaying it to a designated input queue for processing. It handles rendering the terminal output, providing command-line auto-completion, highlighting, and managing a custom interactive console experience. The class integrates with the LineReader and Terminal functionalities, supports dynamic command-line auto-completion, and provides methods for manipulating and displaying data in the terminal. Threading is utilized internally to allow continuous user input while performing other tasks, ensuring an interactive and responsive terminal application.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputReader

      public InputReader(BlockingQueue<String> inputQueue) throws IOException
      Constructs an InputReader instance, initializing the terminal, command completer, highlighter, line reader, background generator, and key bindings for user input handling. This class is used for facilitating command-line interactions and managing user input.
      Parameters:
      inputQueue - the blocking queue that stores input lines provided by the user. This queue is used to pass user inputs between threads for processing.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs during the initialization of the terminal.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Executes the main logic for continuously reading input from the user and placing it into the input queue for processing. This method starts a new thread that runs in the background. The thread reads a line of input from a line reader and adds it to the input queue. If the thread encounters an exception, it will terminate the input-reading loop. The input reading continues as long as the `running` flag is set to true. Once `running` is set to false,
      Specified by:
      run in interface Runnable

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the input processing by clearing the input queue and adding an empty string to it. This method can be used to signal the end of input handling and to reset the input queue to its initial state.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the input processing by setting the `running` flag to true. This flag indicates that the input reading process is active and allows the InputReader instance to continue processing user inputs.

    • printServerMessage

      public void printServerMessage(String message)
      Displays a server message above the current input line in the terminal. The method ensures synchronized access to avoid conflicts when multiple threads attempt to display messages simultaneously.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to be displayed above the current input line.

    • renderScreen

      public void renderScreen(StringBuilder content)
      Renders the screen content by clearing the terminal, applying background processing on the given content, and displaying it along with the current input line. This method ensures proper terminal rendering and resets certain terminal states for a clear display.
      Parameters:
      content - a StringBuilder containing the text content to be rendered on the screen. This text may be modified based on the background processing logic.

    • getCompleter

      public DynamicCompleter getCompleter()
      Retrieves the current DynamicCompleter instance associated with this InputReader. The DynamicCompleter provides functionality for dynamic command-line auto-completion, enabling flexible and context-aware suggestions based on the application's state or user input.
      Returns:
      the DynamicCompleter instance used for managing command-line auto-completion.

    • fillBackground

      public org.jline.utils.AttributedString fillBackground(String input)
      Processes the input string and replaces consecutive spaces with randomly generated symbols while preserving the non-space characters. The method ensures single spaces are retained, whereas double spaces are replaced by symbols generated using the background generator.
      Parameters:
      input - the input string to be processed and modified. This string may contain spaces, which will be handled based on the specified replacement logic.
      Returns:
      an AttributedString representing the modified content with background symbols applied where double spaces were encountered, and other characters preserved.

    • ChangeBackground

      public void ChangeBackground()
